greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Least prime divisor of n with an odd exponent, or 1 if n is a perfect square.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f = factor(core(n))); if (!#f~, 1, vecmin(f[,1])); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 30 2016
def lpf(n): return 1 if n==1 else primefactors(n)[0]
def a(n): return lpf(core(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 17 2017
xref: Cf. A000290 (after its initial zero-term gives the positions of ones in this sequence).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 28 2016
